name: Stephanie Starr
text:
I have hired several local pool companies over the years and have experienced at best mediocre pool service / cleaning. I finally hired ASP - America’s Swimming Pool and I can say this is a top notch company that cares about their customers and does what they say they will do.

I have told the owner several times that he needs to keep hold of Abel Rios. I am in the kitchen most times that he comes and have watched him. He does every single thing you have paid for regardless if it needs to be done or if he could easily skip that step without you knowing.  He does all of it...every single time he comes. I never question if he has been at the house to clean the pool. And he always takes pictures of the pool after servicing and sends them to you through email.

I have had other pool companies where I have questioned did they really do anything...for several months. I kept missing them when they were here. I finally was home and saw the guy literally walk in the back yard ...toss in a chlorine tab in the skimmer basket..come to my front door and leave the card stating he has been here and did this and that...which he had done none of. He didn’t even empty the skimmer basket. Upon calling the owner ...he gave the excuse of “ Well, he’s a big guy and doesn’t like to get down on his knees”. Unbelievable.

I highly recommend ASP. The service you will receive is worth every single penny.

resp.text: Thank you Stephanie. We appreciate you.

name: Natalie Patrick
text: We had a pool leak for over 1 year.  I had dealt with the company in Montgomery that put my pool in.  They came out, looked it over and stated that we needed to get a new liner since it was over 10 years old.  Their "theory" did not make sense to me because it would leak only some of the time.  I refused to spend the $2700 on the new liner and dealt with the "sometime leak".  We finally decided to give Brad Cole a call at ASP, and he quickly was able to determine the problem.  It was a very simple fix that saved us a lot of money.  I appreciate his time, honesty and helpfulness.  He asked questions and gave us great advice not only with our leak problem, but with maintenance tips that will help us maintain our pool better. My only regret is not calling him sooner.  It is nice to know that there are still good business people out there.

name: Anita Speir
text: This has been the worst experience I have ever had with a pool company. I've had a pool in Montgomery for years and have used Hughes as well as Mr. Pool, both of which were very professional. Brad, on the other hand, signed a contract in November for a drain and clean, and then outright lied to me telling me I mailed my check late, then told me he was at a funeral- and sent me pictures of it for some reason. After I offered my condolences and asked to reschedule he informed me he mailed my check back then asked why I wanted it done so soon... 3 months after I requested the drain and clean- I expected to wait this long due to the weather, but the week it was to be done Brad found every reason under the sun to refuse me service. I suspect the original quote he gave me of 900$ was too low ( I usually pay 1,200$) for him to complete the contract. I did not ask for the check to be sent back, or for it to be cancelled, so he voided a contract illegally. After I APOLOGIZED to him for asking for my services to be rendered, even once again offering my condolences for his loss, I assumed his erratic behavior was because of this, Brad still snubbed me, telling me we didn't communicate well. His texts to me were strange and obnoxious and I was completely confused the entire time I had to deal with him. Terrell, however, was pretty helpful and tried to answer my questions to the best of his knowledge.

resp.text: Ms. Speir, This is Brad. Thank you for your review. Since you live in Denver, Colorado we didn't get the opportunity to meet face to face or even speak on the phone for that matter but I believe I would have avoided my mistakes if we would have had the opportunity to do either. It has been my experience and strongly held belief that text messaging is a poor means of communicating one's thoughts or interpreting the meanings of others. Therefore, it is 100% my fault for relying on this means of communication with a potential customer. This was against my best judgement and I was wrong. I sincerely apologize for your having had a negative experience with our company, specifically with me. I will remember and use this experience to better myself and avoid these strategic mistakes that lost the company a valued potential customer. Kind regards, Brad Cole

They also brought my pool back from the dead- it is beautiful now! The price was more than fair for all they did.  I will definitely use them again.

They repeated the process and ultimately did a third step for good measure, of course at no additional cost to us.  On top of everything else, Brad and Eric promised to have the pool ready for my annual Mother's Day spring pool party.  This company is one of the most ethical we have dealt with. text: I called 2 other companies in the area and was told they were full or wouldn't come to Tallassee because to far. I was referred to a guy named Brad with ASP. name: Andrew Dominguez
text: You won't receive better service from any other company. Brad is his team are the best there are. Brad came out to give me an estimate and diagnose an issue that I had with my Hotel swimming pool, and to my surprise he was nearly a thousand dollars lower in price than a competitors bid. Now, this isn't because Brad was trying to take the cheap way out, but rather Brad has taken the time to look through my existing set up, and rather than tell me that I needed to replace everything, he made my problem go away by just replacing one part. My pool now runs property, and has passed inspection because of Brad and his team. I highly recommend Brad to anyone who has pool issues. His honesty and integrity are second to none. Thank you ASP for the fantastic work you did!

name: Adam Hall
text: Brad is an honest guy. His work is top notch!

resp.text: Thank you Adam. We appreciate the review.

name: Fan Yu
text: I was in the process of purchasing a house which needed a number of costly renovations that just so happened to include the pool. Well, pool might be a bit of stretch to describe what in fact appeared to be in the process of becoming a protected wetland. The pool, like the house, was in a state that was the result of years upon years of deferred maintenance. I called several companies with ASP being among the first. And before I continue, let me say that many of these companies won't even call you back, answer their phones or come out for visits like they say so ASP is ahead of the curve just for that reason alone. Brad was exceptionally busy with it being the beginning of the pool season, which he told me right off, and that he would try to get over to the house to inspect the pool. The price I was told it might take to get the pool in a usable state took my breath away! But I wasn't too surprised by it. He stated several times that it could be a little more or much less depending on what was found beneath the cover and behind walls. He was sure to prepare me for the worst. However, after that initial few calls and the visit, I didn't hear back from them. This wasn't a major problem because there was roofing and foundation issues to tend to before swimming could even be considered. Why would you need a backyard water feature when the roof itself was becoming one all by itself? Being that I needed someone to get out to do it fairly quickly once it came time address it, I called another company and they gave me a lower quote and could get started fairly quickly. Well, that went bust because we required a contractor with insurance, just in case of a problem. This guy didn't have it and didn't tell us until AFTER he was supposed to show up to do the job. I called and then he lets me know all that. ABSOLUTELY UNPROFESSIONAL BEHAVIOR that seems to be the hallmark of many service businesses like that these days. I was ready to just put the pool stuff off for awhile until I could find someone trustworthy until Brad calls out-of-the-blue! Just in time!! I was glad because, honestly, I really wanted to work with them from the start due to the good reviews on Google. Not only have they performed all the work needed so far, they did it for WELL under what they told me initially. It seems they prefer to brace you for the worst rather than underestimate costs just to get the job. We have a few more issues to address with the pool, again from the previous owners, that I'm sure Brad will help us iron out. These people have been tremendous and I can't say enough good things about them. They do what they say they're going to do, are available anytime just about and HONEST. I will only call ASP for any of my pool needs. Save yourself some frustration, money and anxiety--CALL ANGIE AND BRAD AT ASP!!!!!! Love them!!!!

name: YOLANDA GARCIA
text: Words aren't enough to describe what an awesome experience I have had in regards to ASP of Montgomery. Due to unexpected military orders, the pool was unfortunately neglected which caused heavy staining of the liner and steps.  The staining caused an unsightly appearance and kept us from enjoying the pool to its maximum potential and subsequently interferred with our ability to lease the home.  Within minutes of reaching out to ASP of Montgomery I was able to receive a quote for services and thoroughly explained what to expect. The attention to detail provided, overall customer service, as well as timely responses has by far exceeded my expectations. text: Several months ago I purchased a home with a pool.  I initially used a different pool business for the pre-purchase inspection and the first few months of maintenance.  Unfortunately, that decision turned into a catastrophic mistake.  I was spending a lot more money and problems arose that had I been using ASP I'm confident would not have occurred.  A couple of months after moving in, I starting looking for a new pool company to use and I found ASP.  Brad and Erik were extremely responsive.  They gave me a fair price for weekly pool maintenance.  When we found significant problems with the pool, they worked with me to figure out the best solutions.  I have nothing but great things to say about them and will recommend them to anyone I know who needs pool work/maintenance.

name: Charles Jones
text: What a pleasant surprise!!  I have a 12,000 gallon KOI pond that is 4 ft. deep and has 2 large bottom drains and a skimmer that feed a filter system much like that of a swimming pool except the media in the filter is plastic beads instead of sand.  It pumps 9,000 gallons of water through the system an hour and runs 24 hours a day.  The water after passing through the filter returns over a waterfall back into the pond.  There are 2 large river birch trees that overhang the pond and the shed a lot of leaves and small twigs into the pond.  Over time I had an accumulation on the bottom of the pond and the drain pipes running under the pond had stopped up and after a routine backwash of the pond the pump lost its prime and I was unable to restart it.  I got the bright idea that since it was similar to a swimming pool to call a swimming pool maintenance company for help.  I looked on the internet and found and called ASP.  Brad answered the phone and when I described my problem he said he could help and he could come 2 days later.  When I explained that I had 60 large KOI fish that required the water flow to keep the water oxygenated he said he was leaving for an appointment and would come as soon as he finished.  He worked on my problem the rest of the day and returned the next morning and got everything working great.  He also altered the plumbing to give me the ability to blow out trash in the drain line.  He found a problem with the multiport valve which we decided needed replacing and added a shut off valve on the waste line to solve the problem until I could get a replacement.  He was great to work with and communicated his findings and suggestions well and his pricing was very reasonable.  I plan to use his service on a regular basis.

name: Tom Townsend
text: I hired Leslie’s about two years ago to replace a pump and filter, based mostly on them explaining their incredible warranty. I have been calling for several days to take advantage of this warranty, and have been getting the runaround from the local people as well as corporate.  First, I called to get on the schedule three different days. I spent about 20 minutes on hold each time, with a recording which continually states their service department’s job is to get pools running so we can get back to enjoying them. Each time, I would get someone who was apologetic about dispatch not getting back to me (more on that one in a moment). Today, the assistant manager at the local store explained that they don’t have a service technician in the Birmingham area because he quit. “He,” not “they!”  He then gave me a kind of “oh well” dismissive tone about it, explaining there was nothing he could do about it, which I believe, based on his position, so I asked to speak to his manager. His manager was polite and respectful, but unable to do anything. I requested to speak to her boss, the district manager, and she spoke with him and assured me he would get right back to me. He hasn’t yet.  My favorite has been from corporate, a service rep named Patrick. When I explained the issue to him, and offered a solution of them outsourcing their tech work, he proudly defended Leslie’s policy of not outsourcing technicians. Apparently no service is better than outsourced service. When I told him I was frustrated about not getting a call back from dispatch after three different days of calling in, he asked if I wanted to talk to the service manager about it. When I said yes, he explained that he would contact the dispatcher to pass a message to him. YES!  The person who will not return my calls is now to be trusted to pass on a message to his boss about him not returning calls!   At this point, I just want my money back and find a more reliable company.

name: Brian Cook
text:
A Definite Thumbs Up!

I don't often write reviews, but felt compelled to do so after my recent experience with H&H Home & Truck Accessory Center, here in Montgomery.

I called the store and spoke with Gary, an H&H District Manager. He was very personable on the phone, and after I explained my problem regarding the soft tonneau cover (that I had purchased elsewhere) on my truck, he suggested that I drive down to the store and he would take a look at it.

Upon my arrival, he introduced himself to me, and we walked out to the parking lot so he could inspect the cover. He diagnosed the problem in about a minute, and started repairing it himself right on the spot.

In less than 30 minutes, he had it fixed as new. Then, when I offered to go settle the bill in the office, he refused to take any payment for his efforts. I practically begged him to let me pay something, but he merely asked that I remember them the next time I start thinking about getting a new truck accessory.

This kind of service is rare in today's world, and I can easily recommend H&H Home & Truck Accessory Center in Montgomery.

resp.text: Thank you so much! That's the kind of service we strive for, customer loyalty is our number one goal!

All of this could have been purchased elsewhere for about 1/2 of this price, but I was retrofitting a pump and needed advice on how to make it work which they were actually very helpful with. They really do have impeccable service, but their prices are not close to being competitive.

name: Debbie Thomas
text: We had purchased a liner from another dealer, but called The Pool Center in Rainbow City since they were local to get the liner installed.  We were told they did install liners for individuals, so we agreed to have it put in by The Pool Center.  Gavin Johnson came to install the pool liner for us and was here for around 4 hours and was paid $500 when the job was finished.  I didn't inspect the pool as I thought they were professionals and I was working,  I work online for a corporate office.  When my husband came home, he saw the liner was crooked and not aligned straight.  He call Gavin and left a message.  Gavin returned his call and said he would drive up and look at the following day, which he did.  When he arrived, I was told by Gavin  that they saw the liner was not straight after they had finished, but the holes had already been cut for the returns.  They thought the water would straighten the wrinkles out.  Gavin and his helper tried to pull a few of the side wrinkles out, but did not correct the problem.  My husband was talking to Gavin and told him the liner was not centered in the pool, Gavin said it was probably just a bad liner and left.  I called The Pool Center and talked with the owner and she said they couldn't do anything about it since we did not buy the liner from them.  They would only correct their error if we had bought the liner from them.  My husband has been undergoing chemo and this is the only reason we didn't install ourselves in the past.  It is bad when a company doesn't stand behind their labor even if you buy the product elsewhere.  I have also posted photos of our pool on the site and am contacting the BBB.

We are busy also , but do what you say you are going to do or at least reach out . I would have understood .

name: Robert Weaver
text: I called a while back to see if they could replace or repair the liner in my pool. They referred me to their installer (Ray Z.) I called him and he and his crew showed up.  He evaluated the pool and said he would check on getting a liner and let me know when it could be replaced.  After about a week I got a hold of him to find out the status and he said he would be here on the following Sunday. I have never heard another word from him and it has been a couple months. He seemed like a nice enough person at the time BUT his lack of communication or action leads me to say "I would NOT recommend Brindlee Mt Pools to install or repair a pool".

resp.text: I am really sorry that this happened. I don't have any record of you calling. I looked back thru my appointments and could not find your name. I am the one that books all of these appointments. This has been a CRAZY year with all the heavy demand for pools. Also, my best service man passed away in June and we have had a hard time finding someone to replace him. If you would like to call and make another appointment, we will be glad to help you. Again, I am VERY sorry if you felt we were not interested. This is not the way we do business and it had to have been an oversight on our part. Please give us a chance to make it right. Thank You, Vickey Olinger BRindlee Mt Pools

name: Tricia Hopper
text: Pool is one year old and a leak started 5 months ago.  Was told to wait til warmer weather and now won't return our calls. Can't leave message on business phone and won't respond to text. What do we do?   I assume call another pool company and PAY!

resp.text: Tricia, I do not remember getting ANY call from you and I am not sure who you are. Did we put in your inground pool or is it an above that you only purchased from me? If it is an inground pool that we built, we can set you an appointment with  a man who has the leak detector or if it is an above ground pool we sell patch kits for the liner. Either way I would like to help you resolve the matter. My store phone DOES receive messages and I have not received a text on my cell phone from you. Maybe you are thinking of another store. If I told you to please wait until the water was warmer, it was because you did not want to pay for the leak detection and it was too cold for our divers to go in at that time. I am sorry for the misunderstanding and would be more than happy to help if we can.

resp.text: Hi Dale, we apologize if there is an issue with your above ground pool cover.  We are happy to exchange it if it is defective and will address any issue with the manufacturer since we do not personally make the covers.   Please bring in the box if you still have it along with receipt.

name: brian bonham
text: Out of stock

resp.text: HI Brian, sorry that we were out of stock of the item that you needed.  We do our best to offer a variety of products.  Unfortunately, it has been a difficult season for shipping of many products due to many of our suppliers being shut down due to COVID-19.  Our above grounds are always very popular and sell out quickly. We are sorry to not have what you needed; however, it is out of our control.  Thank you for your feedback.

name: Jazzcerray Mills
text: Never answered the phone

resp.text: Hi Ms. Long, our apologies for not being able to answer the phone when you needed us.  We stay very busy in the stores this time of making it impossible to answer every phone call that comes through this time of year, especially when we have customers in store we are helping.   We do return (tangible) messages that are left for us. If we do not return a call, it is because either the message was not tangible, or the call back number was left incorrectly.  If you are price checking an item or needing a service call, you can always visit our website and find what you need there or visit us at either one of our retail stores for immediate assistance. Our automated phone system prompts you to have the most common questions answered.  We hope that you were able to find what you needed.  Thank you, Pool Doctor Team.

This year I called for pump repair/replacement. We were quoted one price that was to include new salt cell and replumb so we could maintain salt cell.

text: I have used them for the past year and a half and have had consistently small issues with them. Maybe it’s just my attention to detail, but those details are important to me. Like making sure the screws on my filter assembly on my pump are screwed down all the way so it’s not sucking in air, cross threading the drain on my sand filter and when I tell people at the store about it it takes them two weeks to finally replace it and fix it, when they opened up my pool for the first time this year and started the pump they opened up a access panel on the electric motor side and left it open and didn’t tell me about it leaving it accessible to rain and debris. Two weeks ago I had to replace my pump, just a coincidence. I don’t think so. Between all the details that they don’t pay attention to and the absolute horrible communication between the front Store staff, the staff that clean the pools and the general manager. I could no longer put up with their horrible service. They might be knowledgeable, but all they did was cost me more money.

name: Alan Smith
text: Last December, we approached Anders Pool Company, to install a new liner in our in-ground swimming pool. In beginning, the staff were extremely polite, courteous , knowledgeable  and pleasant to interact with. We picked out the pattern we wanted, and paid 50% of the total cost, to cover the  price of manufacturing the liner which, was very reasonable indeed. Steve came out in late December, to take the measurements of the pool, to pass onto the liner manufacturer. We then agreed to call Anders Pool, early March, to set a date to install the liner. I called Anders Pool, March 9th, and spoke with Steve, and set the date to install the new liner on Wednesday, March 27th. Steve touched base with me, a few days before the install date, to make sure we were good to go. Chris and two other staff, arrived early Wednesday, and drained the pool with a gas pump. They removed the old liner, thoroughly, and I mean thoroughly, cleaned, the pool walls and floors, smoothed over the pool floor and installed the new liner without any issues at all. Then, they set up a vacuum pump and a set a vacuum hose between the pool wall and the pool liner, to suck the trapped air out as we filled the pool from the faucet. The Anders pool liner installers, were extremely Professional and polite throughout the entire operation. They did a fantastic job, far, far, better than their local competition, that I'd used for the two previous liners, over the past 30 years. This liner fits snuggly up against the 4 ft. radius walls of the pool. Anders Pool, took the time, to accurately measure the pools dimensions. The previous pool company, when measuring up, rounded down the measurements, to get an even number. Which, resulted in a poor fitting liner. If you need a new pool liner, make sure you get a quote from Anders Pool Company. Trust me, they'll get you the best price and, the best quality liner, and the best possible installation. This company is well worth my 5 star rating.

resp.text: The experience you are referring to with your neighbor is nowhere near accurate. She bought a flocculant because her pool was cloudy. It did what it was supposed to do which was settle out the cloudiness to the bottom. She was extremely rude and belligerent with my employees and was asked to leave, after we offered her money back and even offered to vacuum her pool for her.  You have been a customer for a couple years now and we have had nothing but trouble and can’t ever seem to please you, so if you aren’t coming back that’s a good solution for both of us. name: Matt Ezell
text:
If you like simple projects turned nightmare, this is a post for you...

$3,000 spent on a simple re-tile job, months of frustration, damage to our property, and within months our pool looks far worse than it did before.

We now have additional significant damage as a result of them improperly attempting to do the job multiple times that we’re going to have to pay to have fixed (coping bricks separating from pad due to shifting due to multiple improper drainings). And of course we now have to pay someone else to do the tile job we already paid Swimming Pool Services for.

Swimming Pool Services drained our fiberglass pool twice (tried for a 3rd before I told them to stop) without first sumping (we have a sump line - they indicated they didn’t know what it was), they used no bracing any of the 2 times they drained our pool, and then left it empty during rainy days - look up ‘drain fiberglass pool’ to learn how terrible this all is. The whole time, they’ve dismissed our concerns via long drawn out email back and forths and continue to assert that they did everything correctly and are trying to help. After they failed to make things right, I requested a refund, which they’ve refused - they will only agree to keep sending guys out to redo portions of the job the same way that resulted in the problems that we have today. It's always worth mentioning that what was estimated to be a "2 to 3 day job" took more than a month - lots of no call/no show and terrible communication across the board. No thanks.

I’ve since spoken to multiple other local FIBERGLASS experts as well as the manufacturer, all of whom assert this was 100% NOT done correctly (with the owner and manager have simply dismissed this, acting as if we’ve only learned info from the Internet. Despite every other expert and resource saying SPS is wrong, SPS continues to assert that they are the experts, even having gone as far as attacking other local businesses work). I’ve been asked no less than 3 times “are you sure they were reputable?”. The manufacture literally put me on speakerphone so everyone could hear my story, to which they responded with gasps, “oh my” and “I’m so sorry”. The warranty manager actually said “it’s a good thing you didn’t have any remaining warranty because that would have definitely voided it - we wouldn’t touch it now”. I’ve also been told that the tiles, grout and adhesive used for the job are incorrect for this size/shape/type of pool, which is something that SPS vehemently argues against - I’ll attach some pictures of the current state of our pool so that you can be the judge for yourself.

The Manager (Dave) AND Owner (Glenn) will act as if they’re trying to help, but it’s seemingly just an act to keep things looking positive online (look here and at the BBB for examples). In conversations they remain friendly/polite, but will only offer to continue doing the very things that have led to us now having a damaged pool. I fully anticipate that the owner will follow up on all reviews acting as if they’ve tried to make things right, just as he seemingly does on all negative reviews, but their idea of making things right is continuing to do things incorrectly - ‘the customer is always wrong’, seems to be their approach to customer service. No thanks.

Unfortunately there’s a max character count for reviews, so I can’t share everything - though I will be elsewhere.

I personally wouldn’t allow these guys to put a bag of salt in my pool going forward.

Update based on owner's claims:
- The response, as expected, is full of misleading statements in an attempt to come across more helpful than is actually the case.
- I turned them away ONCE, not several times. I turned them away because they refused to proceed with repairs without 100% draining my pool and indicated that properly bracing it was out of the question.
- Notice he's not mentioning the 'remedy' that they proposed? Because they didn't propose a remedy. They said they would 100% drain my pool, and would not brace it - which is actually the opposite of a remedy.

resp.text: Matt, I am sorry that you feel this way and felt it necessary to resort to social media! We have been attempting to communicate with you and correct the tile issue which we have explained previously. We have tried several times to complete the work on this project and have been turned away each time. Any work would require lowering the level some at this point which is all that was to be done. We have done many projects like this with no issues and the remedy we proposed should take care of any future shifting as fiberglass pools are prone to do. I would be glad to speak with you personnaly to discuss either completion or other resolutions.  Please also note for reviews online that there is always more to the story...

name: christian Hood
text:
This is reference to he post concerning Mr Hood, I
Am the owner for Clover Land Service and have first
Hand knowledge of the events, I
Was with him. You represent nothing but lies and unfaithfulness and dishonesty, your current customer is still working with us to get us paid and a Mechanics Lien is in place and will remain on you and your
company as well as the customer until the matter is resolved.  I was present that night and directed Mr Hood to
Fill the pool back up partially for your refusal to make
Payment, furthermore the police arrived because you called them and said there was nothing they could do it was a civil matter and later returned after being asked could we keep filling it up and say go
Ahead. The homeowner spoke to
Mr Hood and I
And asked if we could handle it another way, which we have, you now have a mechanic Lien in place. The truth of the matter is you refused to make payment when given a bill, and just as one of your prior contractors told us, you would haggle prices, when given the bill you stated you had to go and see what had to be fixed and haven’t even stepped foot on the site. So I instructed Mr Hood to give you something to fix.  There is the matter of clearing and bringing to
Grade the back yard prior to the dig on the pool 4 hours work that you still owe. The Mechanic lien will stay in place.

resp.text: Again this is a totally false post. Have never seen you on this site, there is no way you have first hand knowledge as to what has transpired. There was no refusal to make payment and in fact payment was offered that was never picked up. Not sure who you say is a prior contractor but this is also inaccurate. There was also no "haggling" of price and Mr. Hood gave a price too low for the job and we agreed to pay more even though we could have held to the original price offered by Mr. Hood. Mr. Hood was offered a draw on the job which was done improperly and never completed. Please stop the harassing posts and text.

name: Kari Snipes
text: Only one star... I wouldn’t have given even a one star! These people cut off my pool ladder and rain that was on the steps going into the pool when they came to close it at the end of the year. Today they came to open it and were supposed to put ladder and rail back on, as well has fix a pipe that is letting water out.  They left a ROCK on top of the leak and told us to go to Lowe’s to buy a pipe. They didn’t put the handrail back on bc of a crack in the cement. (Which they should’ve seen before taking it off when they closed the pool) so now, there is a big sharp piece of metal coming up out of our concrete.  The ladder has a huge gap. It’s totally UNACCEPTABLE. I would not recommend these people.

resp.text: Ms. Snipes, I'm sorry that you felt the need give this rating. I have spoken to both of the Technicians that came to your pool and they talked to and walked the pool with your husband when they completed your pool opening. The ladder and handrail were removed at homeowner request in the Fall. Our Technician spoke with your husband about a pipe that he broke. We don't typically carry adapters for that size pipe and gave your husband the option of us returning to repair and gave instruction on repair if he wanted to save the cost of our return. Our Technicians had the parts to repair and reinstall your rail goods but along with your husband determined that the concrete surrounding the rails were in too bad condition to install them at this time. Our Technician has tried to contact your husband since your review to discuss what happened since he was pleased when they spoke with him before they left. Please feel free to contact me if you would like to discuss. 205-601-3385 ask for Glen.

name: Eric Parish
text:
Earlier in the year, I called and successfully set up an appointment to have someone look at my hot tub. However, the weather took a turn and the appointment had to be postponed.

Today, I called back and the lady who answered told me that my hot tub was too old for them to look at - which may be true. However, her rationale was "once you fix one thing, another one just pops." I kid you not...a service company doesn't want multiple issues to service. She's not in sales, but she's no better at customer service. She didn't want my business and, lucky for her, she won't be getting it.

resp.text: Mr. Parish, I am sorry that you feel that way. We work on many hot tubs and have found from our experience that working on older tubs like yours is almost always an issue. The lady you spoke with tried to explain correctly the reasons for this. We try to look out for the best interest of our customers while protecting our Technicians and their time. I hope you can see your way to remove this review. This is only because you didn't like the answer you received and we hope you find someone that can meet your expectations.

name: Hayley Douglas
text:
Very poor customer service on the owners end.  After a mistake was made on my pool I requested to speak to someone in charge and was told the owner would call me.  I've waited over 3 weeks for a call and not once has he tried to get in touch with me.  I called back several times requesting to speak to him only to be told "he wasn't in and would call me back".
Horrible customer service to not even return a call. He should have reached out to me the second he heard about the mistake.  Granted I do have a small above ground pool but I'm still a paying customer.  We will never shop here again or recommend this business to anyone.

Edited to add after owners response... The things you stated are false.  I did provide a picture of my pool along with the dimensions of it to your staff member.  She put 12'x30' (feet) instead of 12'x30"(inches).  Also, I was told multiple times by your staff that YOU would call me or when I would call back to try to get you they would tell me something you said so I know there was some communication going on.  Another thing I was NOT asking for free chemicals.  I even told the girl that when I went back in in person to have the water checked again to see how bad was. I'm not sure where the miscommunication is happening between you and your staff but that needs to change.   But when someone leaves a review it is that person sharing their experience, good AND bad, they had with that particular business.

resp.text: Ms. Douglas, I am truly sorry if you were trying to reach me but I did not have a message to call as after speaking with my staff, they said they handled your issue and after hearing about what happened they did handle it exactly as I would have. We can't be responsible for chemical dosages used when we are not given the proper gallons for your pool. Our dosages given are all based on information that is supplied by our customers unless we send a Technician out to the pool to measure and get accurate volumns. My staff in an effort to help after getting the proper size of your pool did in fact give you chemicals at no charge to treat. My understanding is that you wanted a continuing supply of chemicals at no charge. We make every effort to ensure that you have what you need and are very conservative when dosing a pool typically, however in this case the overdosing was not something we could control based on the information that we had. Social media and review sites are an easy way to try to hurt a smalll business when we are trying to do the right things. If you would like to discuss now that I know you would like to speak with me offline please send a contact number to my email at gij@swimmingpoolservices.net and I assure you that I will call you to discuss. Again, sorry if there was any misunderstanding but feel free to reach out to me by email.

name: Dale Pangman
text: Very dissatisfied. We had been using Swimming Pool Services (SPS) since we moved into our home in 2008. They opened and closed our pool each season and we bought our chemicals for our pool and hot tub from them as well. The last few years, the service began to drop. When we called to complain, we were told it's hard finding good help. In Oct 2012, we bought a hot tub from them. In Oct 2016, the hot tub quit running. When the repairman came out, he said we needed to buy a new pump. After waiting a few days for SPS to give us an estimate on a new pump, my wife called the maker of the hot tub, Shoreline Dynasty Spa, and got an estimate from them. We decided to try to fix it ourselves and took the pump to Alabama Pump and Supply who fixed it for much less. We then reinstalled it. After reinstalling the pump, we decided to move the spa a few feet and called SPS and were told Glen would call us back shortly as he was on a job. I waited until 2 PM. When I called back, I was told they wouldn't be able to help us until sometime the next week. TIME TO MOVE ON. We had experienced poor service many times over the years, but weren't sure who to use. Thanks to SPS's poor service, we now open and close our pool and we use Shoemaker pool services for our supplies.

name: Christy Webley
text: Initial response by Pools Plus in March was positive. Called for Hayward pool heater service call. Pools Plus is the ONLY authorized repair dealer for Huntsville. First call went fine, but I was told we needed a new heat exchanger and it would have to be installed by an electrician. I contacted the recommended electrician and he said he would coordinate with Pools Plus. That was April 1. When I heard nothing from anyone, I began following up with Pools Plus again the week of April 19. I have called no less than 10 times and NEVER get a call back. NOT ONCE. Everyone says they need to check with John, but John never calls back. I got ahold of the electrician  the week of May 10 and he said he spoke to John about it the week before and the part hadn't even been ordered. Stay as far away from this company as you can. I will be reporting to the Better Business Bureau and filing a formal complaint with Hayward. They need better representation in this area or people need to buy another brand.

text: Worst customer service experience I have ever had! Purchased the pool and everything was going well until we refused to accept the wrong liner that they order. After that the started dragging their feet. I had to run the electrical conduit because they wouldn’t. Finally a guy showed up to run the electrical and did it wrong, failing the inspection and two weeks later still no fix. Took them three weeks to install the ladder. Still waiting on the yard to get fixed , huge mound of dirt and mud. Looks like a lot of wasted money seeing how I’m going to have to pay another contractor to come fix their disaster! Avoid this company at all cost. I will be reporting them to the BBB! 4 months on a basic install, nothing fancy.

name: Ypsilanti Rox
text:
One star because I can't give zero. Hands down the worst customer service and quality of work in the area for pools. Gary came to look at my liner in fall 2017 and we agreed on a new liner in April 2018. April 2018 arrived and I called Gary to get the new liner installed. After at least half a dozen calls, called the main number again and  asked the guy who answered the phone what was going on. They said I was on the liner list for 2017! That doesn't explain Gary not returning calls or texts. And how could we be on the liner list for the previous year!? Just an awful place to do business with. Also had a problem with a Polaris vacuum and called for service a week ago. No call back - NOTHING. Contacted a better company and they responded quickly. Three days after the call, Pools Plus people were in my backyard looking at the pumps. No call to confirm they were coming and then had the nerve to say I could be charged because I didn't call to cancel! Well, they didn't call back to say they were responding to the service call.

The service was much much better five years ago. Now it's garbage and you're better off using anyone else. Horrible service. Horrible communication. It's like they're TRYING to go out of business. Let's hope that happens soon so other customers don't have to deal with this place.

I can’t prove it but I’m fairly confident any positive reviews are anomalies, family or friends of the owner, or paid reviews. This place is inexplicably bad in every regard. If you are thinking of doing business with them, take a moment and ask yourself if your money and time is well spent on people who will ignore you and outright lie.

text: Great Tarp! Fits like a glove! Exceeded our expectations.

text: Bought a coil tarp a couple moths ago and just used it.  Very pleased, and the customer service was very help full and understanding

text: Love it

name: MD Craft
text: I found out by calling the Store, the advertising used to get me to call was false.  To be specific. “Service” is used when I found them online. I called to get a price on replacing my timer and electrical whip (wires) on both motors, his response “ We don’t do that,”. Hmmm. Leslie’s Pools sales and service but they don’t service.   Hmmmm ok.  So I go somewhere else.

name: Wanda New
text: Very knowledgeable and friendly staff. Easy to follow instructions. Our pool has never looked better! Highly recommend using Perfect Weekly. It really works and the water almost sparkles.

name: Daniel McNair
text: Very knowledgeable staff. Dave goes above and beyond for his clients.

name: Tony stockings
text: This is the best pool supply store in the area

name: Mark Vontroba
text: Always kind and service oriented to my wife and I.  We have been patrons for years.

name: GEORGE'S PHONE
text: Spent $6,000+  dollars in this store over the last year and my brand new $2,000 pull pump goes out. It took them 2 trips, and 6 weeks to get my pool back up and running.

name: Brian Stuart
text: Was excited for this store to open as it is just down the street from my home and I had heard good things, but have been very disappointed. I have tried the store on several different occasions now and had issues almost each time. The latest two issues were (1) they had a product on sale, but couldn't figure out how to get it to ring up as the sale price....so told me I would have to pay full price....and (2) they offer a coupon for a percentage off ALL pool chemicals, but then wouldn't honor it for muriatic acid. They argued that it was not a pool chemical. Really?!? Those last two trips have finally sealed the deal and I will be making the slightly further trip to my old store.

name: Tyler Evans
text: Lowest prices around and they have everything you could possibly need for a pool

name: Eddie Koen
text: This is a wonderful place .... very good service

name: Tracie
text: Great customer service

text: Products are cheaper than competitors products
